AtroCty 23-May-17 10:33 PM
found out an alternate:
function modifier_imba_blink_strike_thinker:OnOrder(params) if IsServer() then if params.unit == self:GetCaster() then Timers:CreateTimer(FrameTime(), function() local activity = params.unit:GetCurrentActiveAbility() if activity then if activity:GetName() == "imba_riki_blink_strike" then self:Destroy() end end end) end end end
 (edited)
an extra modifier to check if he is currently casting it

bread 27-May-17 02:48 PM
how do i tell if a modifier was purged as opposed to it being naturally destroyed?
Shush 27-May-17 03:47 PM
@bread As far as I know there is no direct way
there are two ways I can think of
in OnDestroy (or OnRemoved), get the remaining time. if it's below 0, you can assume it has expired, otherwise purged
The other way is to run an interval every frame. If the duration is running out, call a custom function ("modifier_something:CommenceExplosion"), do things there
so when it's purged, nothing happens
as there is no OnDestroy

function ProjectileHit(params, projectileID, modifier) -- Perform an instant attack on hit enemy local procs = false if params.hCaster:IsAlive() then procs = true end modifier.projectile_hit = true params.hCaster:PerformAttack(params.hTarget, procs, procs, true, true, false, false, false) end

function modifier_imba_starfury_passive:OnAttackRecord(params) if IsServer() then if params.attacker == self.parent then if self.projectile_hit then self[params.record] = true self.projectile_hit = nil self.mod = self.parent:AddNewModifier(self.parent, self.item, "modifier_imba_starfury_reduce", {duration = FrameTime()}) end end end end

Shush 01-Jun-17 06:51 PM
@Ia_grib I see. I'd like to recommend you to create your own spells
couple reasons: most spells are fitting to a normal game, not an arena. Laning skills, for instance, will have trouble being useful in this game, which means some heroes will be useless, and some will be very useful
the other reason is: people are getting sick from seeing the same spells over and over again
same heroes, same spells, meh
create your own heroes with a new kit. Yes, it's a lot more work, but you can make those spells become more fitting into this kind of an arena, and people will be more likely to try it out
Just saying
